titleStmt.title: Robert Miller et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5515

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his Excellency
Thos. E. Bramlet Governor of ky
To Your Excellency In Oct 1864 one Mary Doolin was Shot & died from Effects of same, by a gun in hands of one Thomas Kinsloe, now in the state prison at Frankfort Ky, at hard labor,

She Mary Doolin was at Tom Kinsloes house very drunk, allways best of friends on his arrival home after doing a hard days work. Avery Industrious man, and late he finding Lady doolin drunk he & her had a fuss She tried to scald him He thought to scare her with an old shot gun, thinking it not loaded it fired penetrated her hip After being wounded She was taken to the hospital after Several days Some unskillful surgeons amputated her leg, and it was argued by the court she died by the unskillfulness of the surgeons & not so much by the shot. He Tom Thos Kinsloe was Indicted Jan/65 then tried and convicted for a time of three years 1865 We of the Jury and neighbors believe him a proper recepient of Executive relief and ask you to pardon him and let him return to his family as he has always has been a good citizen and believe him honest and think he has not been arrested for any crime Misdemeanor or Felony proceeding the charge now on him and ask You to pardon him at once

Petitioners
Robert Miller
G. W. Crofts
William Miller
J Hutton
Wm Weller
Wm H Schooley
Jos Cosberts
Ed Harrington
Hugh Briarcliff
Patrick
L. W. Bernnet
Wm. H. Boyce
Robt Dillon
James Donely
Denis Mahoney
Thomas Muhonoley
James Bailey
Frank K. Hilbrick
John Reddington
C H. Erdmarf
Thos Moran
John Waters
Hugh McManus
Wm H. Warner
Carter Landram
Samuel Cooling
J H Colston = Juror
C. B. Smith
John Candlin
P. M. Jones
Wm g Cornell
Juryman
Please look at the note written to Jas R. Page

To your honor Thos E Bramlet Gov. of Ky. Thos Kinsloe has been as you see by petition has been a year & 1/4 in the penitentiary of the three years finding and the eight names in right column Surrounded with red ink are jurors the four others I cannot find

Jefferson Cir Ct
vs
Thos Kinsloe
Refused
64
